issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

projectCategory.description: Titanium and related SDKs used in application development
projectCategory.name: Client

resolution.description: Is not a bug in our product
resolution.name: Not Our Bug

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
h3. Steps to Reproduce
I was running Titanium SDK 6.0.1.GA.  I decided to install the update 6.0.2.GA before packaging for the Android Store.  After the update and testing the app with the new SDK version, I decided to  package the app.  After getting prompted for the necessary properteis such as directory and  keystore properteis, and presented with an error saying Android SDK 4.4.2 was not found (See android_build_error1 attachment).  I hit OK and the packaging stops.  I have Android SDK 4.4.2 installed and it shows as installed when I go to the Install SDK page from preferences (see android_installed_sdk attachement) 

h3. Actual Result
An error saying Android SDK 4.4.2 was not found is thrown, and teh packaging stops

h3. Expected Result
The app would be package for dsitribution properly without any errors.
fields.summary: Android: Cannot Package app for Play Store after updating to Titanium SDK 6.0.2.GA

comments.body: Hello, I was able to get around this issue and successfully package the app for the Google Play store.  To resolve the issue I uninstall and reinstalled Android API 4.4.2.  After reading that a similar issue existed with Android Studio and that it might cache related, I decided to uninstall and reinstall the API.
Thanks for the info! Will resolve then.
Closing ticket as it has been established that the issue is not our bug.
